ratings.comment: She teaches the second half of the class and is better than Mcclurg. I never attended lectures and understood everything from her annotated slides. Her group project was much more interesting than the first and her excel case was much easier. Quiz and final aren't hard if you attend lecture/study the slides.
Lecture is a little dry, but overall not bad. She takes forever to grade things, but if you pay attention in lecture they aren't terribly difficult.

Prof Long was always respectful of lecture time and never went over. She was willing to answer student questions and provided many practice problems to prepare for the straightforward quizzes and exams. Exams were easier than most of the practice problems. Good curve and no need to read the textbook for her half of the class. Quick to answer email.

She teaches the second half of this class and it is far easier than the first half. Straightforward lectures, tests came right from lectures and practice problems. Not the most interesting lecturer, but professor Long certainly cares. Don't need to read textbook.

Long teaches part 2 of OTM and material is easier to understand. Content laid out in a simple way and material explained well. Quizzes similar to practice problems in lecture, and she allows a notecard on the final. She is very nice and is accessible outside of class. Group simulation isn't fun, but not too difficult. Would recommend

Teaches 2nd half of class and is far better than McClurg. Don't need to read the book as she covers all what you need to know in lectures. The math problems are easy to do. The hard part of the class is not necessarily being able to do questions but rather deeply understanding the underlying concepts. Her final is fairly easy if you paid attention.
Much better than the other professor who teaches it. All the content you need to know is presented in her lectures, so it is pretty straight forward and organized.
She is a lot better than McClurg at teaching part 2 of OTM. She only teaches this segment in the spring semester. Good practice problems. Final is harder than the midterm, but still very doable

She does a decent job describing the problems and concepts, but lectures are pretty dry and hard to stay interested in. Be careful, unlike the first Professor Tim, her exam questions are NOT like the practice problems shell give you ahead of time.
